---

## GAD-7 vs TSQ

Harmony is an intelligent tool designed for psychologists that utilises natural language processing and AI to perform seamless comparisons between different psychological questionnaires, such as GAD-7 (Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment) and TSQ (Trauma Screening Questionnaire). When comparing GAD-7 vs TSQ, Harmony enables the researcher to understand the correlation between each item, providing a percentage match. This enhances the process of harmonisation and facilitates the comparison of results across various studies. The usage of Harmony in the GAD-7 vs TSQ comparison provides a non-subjective, fast, and reliable evaluation of these psychological instruments. Psychologists can either select from Harmony's extensive database or can upload the desired instruments, even in different languages, in PDF format. When comparing GAD-7 vs TSQ, for instance, you can drag and drop these questionnaires into Harmony's web interface. This optimises the result's accuracy and offers an in-depth analysis of the similarities and differences between each item. Harmony is an essential tool in the process of studying, comparing, and understanding two crucial psychological questionnaires such as GAD-7 and TSQ. To use Harmony for a GAD-7 vs TSQ comparison, visit [Harmony's web interface](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) and revolutionize your harmonisation process. Harmony bridges the gap between scientific research and computational technology, empowering researchers to break new ground in psychological study.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
